Dictionary.Phrase: Master - Communicator sends request to a device and receives answer. Slave - Communicator passively waits for data from a device.

Individual - Communicator establishes an individual TCP connection with each device. Shared - Communicator establishes a single shared connection for all devices of the communication line using specified remote IP address. Shared connection is used, for example, if the devices are connected via an Ethernet-Serial gateway.
Remote DNS name or IP address in case of using shared connection.
In individual connection mode it is used as a default TCP port if no port is specified for a device. In shared connection mode the parameter is required. The 502 port is the default Modbus TCP port.
Specifies time interval to reconnect after an unsuccessful attempt.
If set, the connection is active between communication sessions. Otherwise, the connection is terminated after each session.
Indicates whether to disconnect if a session fails.
Master - after establishing connection Communicator sends request to a device and receives answer. Slave - Communicator passively waits for data from a device.

Individual - Communicator establishes an individual TCP connection with each device. Shared - Communicator establishes a single shared connection for all devices of the communication line. Shared connection is used, for example, if the devices are connected via an Ethernet-Serial gateway.

The method of binding a new incoming connection to a device: By IP address - remote IP address equals a device string address. By hello packet - a first package received from a device contains the string address. Driver determined - algorithm is implemented in the device driver.
Local TCP port for incoming connections. Incoming connections must be allowed by a firewall.
The time after which an inactive client is disconnected.
Master - Communicator sends request to a device and receives answer. Slave - Communicator passively waits for data from a device.
The method of binding a new incoming connection to a device: By IP address - remote IP address equals a device string address. Driver determined - algorithm is implemented in the device driver.
Local UDP port for incoming connections. Incoming connections must be allowed by a firewall.
The default remote UDP port. The same for all devices of the communication line.
The default remote IP address. It can be used, for example, if the devices are connected via an Ethernet-Serial gateway.
